document.docAuthor: Chan, Benny K. K., Ju, Se-Jong & Kim, Se-Joo
document.docTitle: Vulcanolepas fijiensis Chan & Ju & Kim 2019, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: A new species of hydrothermal vent stalked barnacle Vulcanolepas (Scalpelliforms: Eolepadidae) from the North Fiji Basin, Southwestern Pacific Ocean

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A new species of hydrothermal vent stalked barnacle Vulcanolepas (Scalpelliforms: Eolepadidae) from the North Fiji Basin, Southwestern Pacific Ocean

subSubSection.paragraph: Paratype . ASIZCR-000411, same data as holotype.

Diagnosis.
Vulcanolepas
with small sized peduncular scales, ~ 0.43 mm length, protruding 0.3 mm from peduncle. First tooth of mandible large, sharp. Anterior and posterior rami of cirrus I with length ratio of rami bearing antenniform segments to robust segments ~1:1.

Description (based on holotype , except capitulum and cirrus I include paratype for comparison). Hermaphrodite capitulum higher than wide; capitular height:width ratio 1.3:1 ( Figure 3 ). Capitulum with eight approximate plates; inter-spaces occupied by thin, cuticular membrane ( Figure 3 A–C). Carinal umbo apical, carina slightly bowed, surface with 16 horizontal growth lines; carinal height ~2/3 capitular height ( Figure 3D ). Tergum quadrangular, single ridge extending from basal angle to apex (apex angle 86 o ); surface with V-shaped growth lines; basal angle of tergum (60 o ), slightly elevated from capitular-peduncular edge, ~1/4 total height of capitulum ( Figure 3 ). Scutum quadrangular, umbo apical, basal angle 55 o , located at capitular-peduncular edge ( Figure 3 ), surface with 12 growth ridges. Medial latus equilateral triangular; umbo apical, apical angle 32.6 o ; surface with 20 straight horizontal growth lines. Rostrum triangular, with 14 horizontal growth lines ( Figure 3E ). Paratype with similar capitular morphology to holotype ( Figure 6A ). Inner surfaces of capitular plates white, smooth ( Figure 3F ).

Peduncle: Peduncular-capitular ratio ~2:1 ( Figure 3A ). Peduncle with 32 scales/whorl just below capitular region, 28 scales/whorl at mid region of peduncle; scale width 0.43 mm (averaged from 3 scales), scales projecting 0.5 mm (averaged from 3 scales) from peduncle; scales rounded, smaller at capitular region of peduncle, larger at basal region.

Cirri IV–VI similar in morphology, both rami similar in length; shape of segments similar through whole length of rami ( Figure 4 D–F); intermediate segments of cirri IV–VI bearing 7 pairs of long setae ( Figure 4 D–F).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 3.
Ƒulcanolepas fijiensis
sp. nov.
Holotype. A. Whole view, habitus, left side. B, C. Capitulum (left and right sides), showing paired terga (T) and scuta (S) and unpaired carina (CA), lateral (L) and rostrum (R). D, E. Capitulum, carinal and rostral view. F. Dissected capitulum, showing inner surface of capitular plates (white and smooth). Cirrus I is not separated from the remaining pairs of cirri (I, II, III indicate cirri I, II and III).

subSubSection.paragraph: Penis without basi-dorsal point, ~½ length of cirrus VI ( Figures 4G , 6C ).
Etymology. The name denotes the discovery of this barnacle in the North Fiji Basin.
Distribution. Presently only recorded in the North Fiji Basin.
